1. Introduction

This Cookie Policy explains how MEMOPYK EURL (“we,” “us,” “our”) uses cookies and similar tracking technologies on our website memopyk.com. By continuing to browse our site, you consent to our use of cookies as described below.


2. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files placed on your device (computer, tablet, smartphone) when you visit a website. They help the site remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size) over a period of time.


3. Types of Cookies We Use

  1. Strictly Necessary Cookies
  • Essential for the website to function properly (e.g., session cookies, security tokens).
  1. Performance & Analytics Cookies
  • Collect anonymous information about how visitors use our site (e.g., pages visited, error messages) via Google Analytics.
  1. Functional Cookies
  • Remember your choices to improve your experience (e.g., language preference, video player settings).
  1. Targeting & Advertising Cookies
  • Track your browsing habits to deliver relevant ads on our site or third-party sites. We do not currently employ such cookies ourselves.

4. Specific Cookies We Set

NameProviderPurposeExpiry_session_idmemopyk.comKeeps you logged inSession_gid, _gagoogle.comGoogle Analytics user/session tracking1–2 yearscookielawinfomemopyk.comStores your cookie consent preferences1 year

5. Third-Party Cookies

We embed content (e.g., videos) and analytics tools (Google Analytics). Those third parties may set their own cookies.


6. Your Cookie Choices

Most browsers allow you to refuse or delete cookies. You can learn how to manage cookies in your browser here:

  • Chrome: https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647
  • Firefox: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/enable-and-disable-cookies-website-preferences
  • Safari: https://support.apple.com/guide/safari/manage-cookies-and-website-data-sfri11471/mac
  • Edge: https://support.microsoft.com/microsoft-edge/delete-cookies-in-microsoft-edge

If you disable strictly necessary cookies, parts of our site may not function. Disabling performance cookies will prevent us from understanding how the site is used and improving it.


7. Changes to This Cookie Policy

We may update this policy as our site evolves or to reflect changes in applicable law. We will post any changes here with a revised “Last updated” date.


8. Contact Us

For questions about our Cookie Policy, email us at info@memopyk.com

Pour toute question, écrivez-nous à : info@memopyk.com.

  • “Customer” or “you”: any individual or organization purchasing Services

  • “Order”: your validated request submitted via our website or e-mail

2. Scope

These Terms apply to all contracts for Services between MEMOPYK and its Customers, without distinction of country.


3. Ordering

  1. Customer validates the proposed quotation
  2. Customer pays the deposit
  3. We confirm receipt and do the work.
  4. Customer validate the result and pay the remaining 50% amount


4. Prices & Payment Methods

  • Currency & Taxes: EUR (France) or USD (international), VAT included where applicable.
  • Methods: Credit card, bank transfer, PayPal, telegraphic transfer (TT).
  • Timing: Deposit upon order, balance due on delivery.
  • Late payment: statutory interest (France : Code de commerce L.441-6; elsewhere : 1.5 % per month).


5. Execution & Delivery

  • Work begins after deposit is received.
  • You receive digital proofs with watermark via a private gallery (two rounds of revisions included).
  • Final deliverables (high-res files or online album) by download link.


6. Cancellation & Refund

  • Once proof is delivered, the right of withdrawal ends.
  • Cancellation before proofs: full refund minus €50 processing fee.
  • No refunds after proofs are provided.


7. Intellectual Property

  • You grant us a non‐exclusive license to use your media to provide the Services.
  • After full payment, you receive a licence for personal, non‐commercial use of the final files.
  • MEMOPYK retains copyright on its proprietary editing methods and templates.


8. Liability

  • We use professional care but cannot guarantee perfection for every image.
  • Our total liability is capped at the amount paid.
  • We are not responsible for data loss if you do not back up your originals.


9. Force Majeure

Neither party is liable for delays or failures caused by events beyond their control (e.g., natural disasters, strikes, pandemics).


11. Applicable Law & Jurisdiction

These Terms are governed by French law. Any disputes shall be submitted to the courts of Figeac, France.
